tool.name: FileFilter
tool.description: Extracts or manipulates portions of data from peak, feature or consensus-feature files.
tool.command:
@QUOTE_FOO@ @EXT_FOO@ #import re
## Preprocessing mkdir in && ln -s '$in' 'in/${re.sub("[^\w\-_]", "_", $in.element_identifier)}.$gxy2omsext($in.ext)' && mkdir out && #if $spectra.blackorwhitelist.file: mkdir spectra.blackorwhitelist.file && ln -s '$spectra.blackorwhitelist.file' 'spectra.blackorwhitelist.file/${re.sub("[^\w\-_]", "_", $spectra.blackorwhitelist.file.element_identifier)}.$gxy2omsext($spectra.blackorwhitelist.file.ext)' && #end if #if $consensus.blackorwhitelist.file: mkdir consensus.blackorwhitelist.file && ln -s '$consensus.blackorwhitelist.file' 'consensus.blackorwhitelist.file/${re.sub("[^\w\-_]", "_", $consensus.blackorwhitelist.file.element_identifier)}.$gxy2omsext($consensus.blackorwhitelist.file.ext)' && #end if #if $id.blacklist: mkdir id.blacklist && ln -s '$id.blacklist' 'id.blacklist/${re.sub("[^\w\-_]", "_", $id.blacklist.element_identifier)}.$gxy2omsext($id.blacklist.ext)' && #end if
## Main program call
set -o pipefail && @EXECUTABLE@ -write_ctd ./ && python3 '$__tool_directory__/fill_ctd.py' '@EXECUTABLE@.ctd' '$args_json' '$hardcoded_json' && @EXECUTABLE@ -ini @EXECUTABLE@.ctd -in 'in/${re.sub("[^\w\-_]", "_", $in.element_identifier)}.$gxy2omsext($in.ext)' -out 'out/output.${out_type}' #if $spectra.blackorwhitelist.file: -spectra:blackorwhitelist:file 'spectra.blackorwhitelist.file/${re.sub("[^\w\-_]", "_", $spectra.blackorwhitelist.file.element_identifier)}.$gxy2omsext($spectra.blackorwhitelist.file.ext)' #end if #if $consensus.blackorwhitelist.file: -consensus:blackorwhitelist:file 'consensus.blackorwhitelist.file/${re.sub("[^\w\-_]", "_", $consensus.blackorwhitelist.file.element_identifier)}.$gxy2omsext($consensus.blackorwhitelist.file.ext)' #end if #if $id.blacklist: -id:blacklist 'id.blacklist/${re.sub("[^\w\-_]", "_", $id.blacklist.element_identifier)}.$gxy2omsext($id.blacklist.ext)' #end if
## Postprocessing && mv 'out/output.${out_type}' '$out' #if "ctd_out_FLAG" in $OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS && mv '@EXECUTABLE@.ctd' '$ctd_out' #end if

param.name: in
param.label: Input file
param.help: select consensusxml,featurexml,mzml data sets(s)

param.name: out_type
param.label: Output file type -- default: determined from file extension or content

param.name: rt
param.label: Retention time range to extract

param.name: mz
param.label: m/z range to extract (applies to ALL ms levels!)

param.name: int
param.label: Intensity range to extract

param.name: sort
param.label: Sorts the output according to RT and m/z

param.name: sn
param.label: Write peaks with S/N > 'sn' values only

param.name: rm_pc_charge
param.label: Remove MS(2) spectra with these precursor charges
param.help: All spectra without precursor are kept! (space separated list, in order to allow for spaces in list items surround them by single quotes)

param.name: pc_mz_range
param.label: MSn (n>=2) precursor filtering according to their m/z value
param.help: Do not use this flag in conjunction with 'mz', unless you want to actually remove peaks in spectra (see 'mz'). RT filtering is covered by 'rt' and compatible with this flag

param.name: pc_mz_list
param.label: List of m/z values
param.help: If a precursor window covers ANY of these values, the corresponding MS/MS spectrum will be kept (space separated list, in order to allow for spaces in list items surround them by single quotes)

param.name: level
param.label: MS levels to extract
param.help: (space separated list, in order to allow for spaces in list items surround them by single quotes)

param.name: sort_peaks
param.label: Sorts the peaks according to m/z

param.name: no_chromatograms
param.label: No conversion to space-saving real chromatograms
param.help: e.g. from SRM scans

param.name: remove_chromatograms
param.label: Removes chromatograms stored in a file

param.name: remove_empty
param.label: Removes spectra and chromatograms without peaks

param.name: mz_precision
param.label: Store base64 encoded m/z data using 32 or 64 bit precision

param.name: int_precision
param.label: Store base64 encoded intensity data using 32 or 64 bit precision

param.name: indexed_file
param.label: Whether to add an index to the file when writing

param.name: zlib_compression
param.label: Whether to store data with zlib compression (lossless compression)

param.name: masstime
param.label: Apply MS Numpress compression algorithms in m/z or rt dimension (recommended: linear)

param.name: lossy_mass_accuracy
param.label: Desired (absolute) m/z accuracy for lossy compression
param.help: (e.g. use 0.0001 for a mass accuracy of 0.2 ppm at 500 m/z, default uses -1.0 for maximal accuracy)

param.name: intensity
param.label: Apply MS Numpress compression algorithms in intensity dimension (recommended: slof or pic)

param.name: float_da
param.label: Apply MS Numpress compression algorithms for the float data arrays (recommended: slof or pic)

section.name: spectra
section.title: Remove spectra or select spectra (removing all others) with certain properties

param.name: remove_zoom
param.label: Remove zoom (enhanced resolution) scans

param.name: remove_mode
param.label: Remove scans by scan mode

param.name: remove_activation
param.label: Remove MSn scans where any of its precursors features a certain activation method

param.name: remove_collision_energy
param.label: Remove MSn scans with a collision energy in the given interval

param.name: remove_isolation_window_width
param.label: Remove MSn scans whose isolation window width is in the given interval

param.name: select_zoom
param.label: Select zoom (enhanced resolution) scans

param.name: select_mode
param.label: Selects scans by scan mode.

param.name: select_activation
param.label: Retain MSn scans where any of its precursors features a certain activation method

param.name: select_collision_energy
param.label: Select MSn scans with a collision energy in the given interval

param.name: select_isolation_window_width
param.label: Select MSn scans whose isolation window width is in the given interval

param.name: select_polarity
param.label: Retain MSn scans with a certain scan polarity

section.name: blackorwhitelist
section.title: Black or white listing of of MS2 spectra by spectral similarity

param.name: file
param.label: Input file containing MS2 spectra that should be retained or removed from the mzML file
param.help: Matching tolerances are taken from 'spectra:blackorwhitelist:similarity_threshold|rt|mz' options.. select mzml data sets(s)

param.name: similarity_threshold
param.label: Similarity threshold when matching MS2 spectra
param.help: (-1 = disabled)

param.name: rt
param.label: Retention tolerance [s] when matching precursor positions
param.help: (-1 = disabled)

param.name: mz
param.label: m/z tolerance [Th] when matching precursor positions
param.help: (-1 = disabled)

param.name: use_ppm_tolerance
param.label: If ppm tolerance should be used
param.help: Otherwise Da are used

param.name: blacklist
param.label: True: remove matched MS2
param.help: False: retain matched MS2 spectra. Other levels are kept

param.name: q
param.label: Overall quality range to extract [0:1]

param.name: map
param.label: Non-empty list of maps to be extracted from a consensus (indices are 0-based)
param.help: (space separated list, in order to allow for spaces in list items surround them by single quotes)

param.name: map_and
param.label: Consensus features are kept only if they contain exactly one feature from each map (as given above in 'map')

section.name: blackorwhitelist
section.title: Black or white listing of of MS2 spectra by consensus features

param.name: blacklist
param.label: True: remove matched MS2
param.help: False: retain matched MS2 spectra. Other levels are kept

param.name: file
param.label: Input file containing consensus features whose corresponding MS2 spectra should be removed from the mzML file
param.help: Matching tolerances are taken from 'consensus:blackorwhitelist:rt' and 'consensus:blackorwhitelist:mz' options.. If consensus:blackorwhitelist:maps is specified, only these will be used.. select consensusxml data sets(s)

param.name: maps
param.label: Maps used for black/white list filtering
param.help: (space separated list, in order to allow for spaces in list items surround them by single quotes)

param.name: rt
param.label: Retention tolerance [s] for precursor to consensus feature position

param.name: mz
param.label: m/z tolerance [Th] for precursor to consensus feature position

param.name: use_ppm_tolerance
param.label: If ppm tolerance should be used
param.help: Otherwise Da are used

param.name: charge
param.label: Charge range to extract

param.name: size
param.label: Size range to extract

param.name: remove_meta
param.label: Expects a 3-tuple (=3 entries in the list)
param.help: i.e. <name> 'lt|eq|gt' <value>; the first is the name of meta value, followed by the comparison operator (equal, less or greater) and the value to compare to. All comparisons are done after converting the given value to the corresponding data value type of the meta value (for lists, this simply compares length, not content!)! (space separated list, in order to allow for spaces in list items surround them by single quotes)

section.name: id
section.title: ID options
section.help: The Priority of the id-flags is: remove_annotated_features / remove_unannotated_features -> remove_clashes -> keep_best_score_id -> sequences_whitelist / accessions_whitelist

param.name: remove_clashes
param.label: Remove features with id clashes (different sequences mapped to one feature)

param.name: keep_best_score_id
param.label: in case of multiple peptide identifications, keep only the id with best score

param.name: sequences_whitelist
param.label: Keep only features containing whitelisted substrings
param.help: e.g. features containing LYSNLVER or the modification (Oxidation). To control comparison method used for whitelisting, see 'id:sequence_comparison_method' (space separated list, in order to allow for spaces in list items surround them by single quotes)

param.name: sequence_comparison_method
param.label: Comparison method used to determine if a feature is whitelisted

param.name: accessions_whitelist
param.label: keep only features with white listed accessions
param.help: e.g. sp|P02662|CASA1_BOVIN (space separated list, in order to allow for spaces in list items surround them by single quotes)

param.name: remove_annotated_features
param.label: Remove features with annotations

param.name: remove_unannotated_features
param.label: Remove features without annotations

param.name: remove_unassigned_ids
param.label: Remove unassigned peptide identifications

param.name: blacklist
param.label: Input file containing MS2 identifications whose corresponding MS2 spectra should be removed from the mzML file
param.help: Matching tolerances are taken from 'id:rt' and 'id:mz' options.. This tool will require all IDs to be matched to an MS2 spectrum, and quit with error otherwise. Use 'id:blacklist_imperfect' to allow for mismatches select idxml data sets(s)

param.name: rt
param.label: Retention tolerance [s] for precursor to id position

param.name: mz
param.label: m/z tolerance [Th] for precursor to id position

param.name: blacklist_imperfect
param.label: Allow for mismatching precursor positions (see 'id:blacklist')

param.name: max_intensity
param.label: maximal intensity considered for histogram construction
param.help: By default, it will be calculated automatically (see auto_mode). Only provide this parameter if you know what you are doing (and change 'auto_mode' to '-1')! All intensities EQUAL/ABOVE 'max_intensity' will be added to the LAST histogram bin. If you choose 'max_intensity' too small, the noise estimate might be too small as well. If chosen too big, the bins become quite large (which you could counter by increasing 'bin_count', which increases runtime). In general, the Median-S/N estimator is more robust to a manual max_intensity than the MeanIterative-S/N

param.name: auto_max_stdev_factor
param.label: parameter for 'max_intensity' estimation (if 'auto_mode' == 0): mean + 'auto_max_stdev_factor' * stdev

param.name: auto_max_percentile
param.label: parameter for 'max_intensity' estimation (if 'auto_mode' == 1): auto_max_percentile th percentile

param.name: auto_mode
param.label: method to use to determine maximal intensity: -1 --> use 'max_intensity'; 0 --> 'auto_max_stdev_factor' method (default); 1 --> 'auto_max_percentile' method

param.name: win_len
param.label: window length in Thomson

param.name: bin_count
param.label: number of bins for intensity values

param.name: min_required_elements
param.label: minimum number of elements required in a window (otherwise it is considered sparse)

param.name: noise_for_empty_window
param.label: noise value used for sparse windows

param.name: write_log_messages
param.label: Write out log messages in case of sparse windows or median in rightmost histogram bin

param.name: force
param.label: Overrides tool-specific checks

param.name: test
param.label: Enables the test mode (needed for internal use only)

param.name: OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS
param.label: Optional outputs

data.name: ctd_out
data.label: ${tool.name} on ${on_string}: ctd
data.filter: OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS is not None and "ctd_out_FLAG" in OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS

tool.help:
Extracts or manipulates portions of data from peak, feature or consensus-feature files.
For more information, visit http://www.openms.de/doxygen/release/2.6.0/html/TOPP_FileFilter.html
